alert.note: Alert for Prairie; White; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 31 at 10:36AM CDT until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a Flood Advisory for the following river in Arkansas... White River At Georgetown affecting White, Prairie and Woodruff Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...White River At Georgetown. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Hurricane Lake Wildlife Management Area and Raft Creek Bottoms inundated. Roads in the bottoms are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.8 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 20.5 feet. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date White River Georgetown 21.0 20.7 Thu 10 AM 20.8 20.8 20.8 20.8 1 PM 3/31 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
